perturbation.original_text: 6.1 Payment Terms. JRVS shall submit an invoice to the Distributor upon shipment of Products to the Distributor. The invoice shall state the amount to be paid by the Distributor for all Products in such shipment, as well as any taxes, duties or excises paid by JRVS which shall be reimbursed by the Distributor in accordance with Section 5.4. Terms of payment shall be net thirty (30) days. All payments shall be in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Payment Terms. JRVS shall submit an invoice to the Distributor upon shipment of Products to the Distributor. The invoice shall state the amount to be paid by the Distributor for all Products in such shipment, as well as any taxes, duties or excises paid by JRVS which shall be reimbursed by the Distributor in accordance with Section 5.4. Terms of payment shall be net ninety (90) days. All payments shall be in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the payment terms from net 30 days to net 90 days. While seemingly beneficial to the distributor, this could violate Taiwan's Fair Trade Act or related regulations concerning reasonable payment periods, potentially leading to penalties or legal challenges if such extended terms are deemed exploitative, particularly if the distributor is a smaller entity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Taiwan's Fair Trade Act and related regulations concerning reasonable payment periods.

perturbation.original_text: 7.2 Inspection and Acceptance. The Distributor shall have thirty (30) days (the “Inspection Period”) upon receipt of each shipment to inspect and test the Products. If the Distributor determines any unit of Products defective, the Distributor shall promptly notify JRVS of such defects. Defective Products may be returned for retest, evaluation and examination subject to JRVS Returned Material Authorization (“RMA”) procedure; provided, that such written notification and request for an RMA number must be received by JRVS during the Inspection Period. Returns must be prepaid by Distributor. When requesting a return authorization, Distributor must supply Distributor’s purchase order number and JRVS’s invoice number. Product description must include lot number and wafer numbers.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.2 Inspection and Acceptance. The Distributor shall have five (5) days (the “Inspection Period”) upon receipt of each shipment to inspect and test the Products. If the Distributor determines any unit of Products defective, the Distributor shall promptly notify JRVS of such defects. Defective Products may be returned for retest, evaluation and examination subject to JRVS Returned Material Authorization (“RMA”) procedure; provided, that such written notification and request for an RMA number must be received by JRVS during the Inspection Period. Returns must be prepaid by Distributor. When requesting a return authorization, Distributor must supply Distributor’s purchase order number and JRVS’s invoice number. Product description must include lot number and wafer numbers.
perturbation.explanation: The change reduces the inspection period from 30 days to 5 days. This could be deemed unreasonable and unfair under Taiwanese consumer protection laws, particularly given the complexity of cryptocurrency mining rigs, potentially invalidating this clause or leading to legal challenges.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Taiwanese Consumer Protection Act regarding reasonable inspection periods.

perturbation.original_text: 13.2 Limitation on Actions. NO ACTIONS, REGARDLESS OF FORM, ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT, MAY BE BROUGHT BY DISTRIBUTOR MORE THAN ONE (1) YEAR AFTER THE CAUSE OF ACTION HAS ARISEN.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.2 Limitation on Actions. NO ACTIONS, REGARDLESS OF FORM, ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT, MAY BE BROUGHT BY DISTRIBUTOR MORE THAN SIX (6) MONTHS AFTER THE CAUSE OF ACTION HAS ARISEN.
perturbation.explanation: The modification reduces the statute of limitations for legal actions from one year to six months. This may conflict with Taiwan's Civil Code, which generally provides for longer statutory limitation periods for contract-related claims. Shortening this period could be viewed as unduly restrictive and unenforceable under Taiwanese law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Taiwan's Civil Code regarding statute of limitations for contract claims.
